title: Google - Wikipedia
snippet: Together, they own about 14% of its publicly listed shares and control 56% of its stockholder voting power through super-voting stock. The company went public via an initial public offering (IPO) in 2004. In 2015, Google was reorganized as a wholly owned subsidiary of Alphabet Inc.

title: Alphabet Inc. - Wikipedia
snippet: Alphabet Inc. is an American multinational technology conglomerate holding company headquartered in Mountain View, California. Alphabet is the world's third-largest technology company by revenue, after Amazon and Apple, the largest technology company by profit, and one of the world's most valuable ...

title: Google | History & Facts; Products & Services | Britannica Money
snippet: Since 2015, Google has been a subsidiary of the holding company Alphabet, Inc. More than 70% of worldwide online search requests are handled by Google, placing it at the heart of most Internet usersâ€™ experience.

title: The REAL Power: Who Owns 51% of Google?
snippet: ... No single person or organization holds a controlling stake in Google. Ownership is spread across a wide range of shareholders, from its founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin to numerous individual and institutional investors.

title: Who Owns Google in 2025? Read about Alphabet Inc.!
snippet: Google is the largest and most well-known subsidiary of the multinational technology conglomerate, Alphabet Inc. It is the direct owner of Google. Alphabet Inc.
